R. H. D. January 14th, 1908
My dear Neihardt: —
div1.p: A Bundle of Myrrh is my bouquet for 1908. It does me good to see this little collection between covers. Upon rereading it, I am not prepared to change my opinion, except to confess that I see more beauty now than I did even in the beginning, — although it got under my skin in the days gone by.

That is a wonderful dedication you have written to your mother. How the dear woman must feel, when she reads:
"None knew but I how high you could aspire!"

I can see her now, looking at you as though she had suddenly come from out a dream. Surely, she understands. "The others ranged about the room" will, perhaps, live in darkness, but, in the world outside, here and there, they will know you, and the fragrance of the Bundle shall live.
